Position Description

The University of Pittsburgh is seeking a Regulatory and Compliance Coordinator who will be responsible for conducting audits, monitoring clinical research protocols, and organizing regulatory files.

Position Description

The research focus is on the development of a new mass spectrometry-based approached for the identification of secreted factors that are relevant to aging and diseases pathogenesis.

The Senior Lab Manager will be responsible for the conceptual and technical development of highly-sophisticated research projects, carrying them out at the bench as the primary experimentalist, troubleshooting technical problems, and assist the PI with analyzing the data, preparing manuscripts for publication, and preparing grants. The successful candidate will also be expected to function as the supervising lab manager and chief experimentalist, thus, be accountable for the overall operations of the workgroup and all scientists in the lab.

The incumbent will have a critical impact on the overall functioning of the lab and will be expected to formulate new practices and systems to address unique situations in the lab. The successful applicant will be responsible for training and assigning work to all lab personnel, and assisting the PI with interviewing and selecting new lab personnel, assessing performance, and assessing personnel for re-hiring or termination.

The Senior Lab Manager will directly interact with granting agencies, industry, other lab personnel, and scientific faculty as a representative of the lab in order to fulfill these duties. The incumbent will have near total responsibility for the lab budget and for approving purchases within the lab, as an agent of the PI.

Administrative duties will include:
(i) keeping and/or overseeing environmental safety logs
(ii) ordering and monitoring inventories of lab supplies
(iii) updating equipment service
(iv) being primarily responsible for generating and maintaining all protocols and certifications

General laboratory duties will include:
(i) supervising the maintenance of biochemical and analytical apparatus
(ii) daily testing and calibration of the labs nano-liquid chromatography systems
(iii) troubleshooting and repairing benchtop laboratory equipment
(iv) maintaining chemical waste storage/disposal
(v) maintaining primary and cell line cultures

Specialized laboratory duties will include:
(i) developing and integration of custom nano-electrospray interfaces with high-resolution ion trap mass spectrometers
(ii) performing and evaluating biochemical extraction procedures that utilize click chemistry to isolate newly synthesized proteins
(iii) developing multi-dimensional separation methods that employ strong cation exchange, high pH, and low pH chromatography
(iv) mass spectrometry-based peptide and protein sequencing
(v) biochemical and immunohistochemical studies
(vi) mitochondrial studies including targeted quantification of mitochondrial proteins in human plasma
(vii) assessing all analytical aspects of liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry assays

The successful candidate will play a major role in the development of new lines of research in aging research and cancer, particularly as it relates to the study of cell autonomous and non-autonomous mechanisms of aging in human samples as well as in vitro and in vivo models.


Education Required
PhD or ScD

Minimum Related Experience Level Required
5-6 years experience

Additional Education and/or Experience Essential to the Position

The applicant will ideally have earned a Mastersâ or Doctoral degree in a scientific discipline, but should at least have earned a Bachelor of Science degree from a reputable college or university, preferably with a major in Biology, Biochemistry, or Neuroscience. BS applicants must also have at least 5 yearsâ combined experience relevant to laboratory techniques and management, as delineated below.

At least 5 years of cumulative scientific laboratory experience, which may consist of a combination of undergraduate and post-graduate time. This experience should have been in a basic science lab, preferably molecular biology or neuroscience, and should have involved experience with any combination of the techniques listed in the job description above. The applicant should be familiar with sophisticated scientific instrumentation, mechanical design, and computer control. Additional office, business, and/or laboratory management experience is highly desired, as a major portion of the job will involve organizing and running the lab.

Previous experience with molecular biology, biochemistry, and chemistry techniques, primary culture preparation and maintenance, immunohistochemistry, and mass spectrometry, is preferred.
